title: "Fascination, Amnesia, and Hyper-Amnesia in Perception"
first_phrase: In the previous 155 tokens, the author discusses the possibility of achieving higher spiritual results via hypnotic trance by creating an adequate atmosphere and intention. In this context, the text delves into the phenomenon of amnesia and hyperamnesia during intense fascination, where subjects often experience instant amnesia during experimental or therapeutic demonstrations. The author suggests that hyper-attention and an increased state of vigilance lead to the onset of amnesia. Hormones, neurotransmitters, and peptides associated with wakefulness are released, resulting in a narrowing of visual perception referred to as the “tunnel vision.” The following 200 tokens are dedicated to discussing the potential therapeutic applications of this phenomenon and further exploring the concept of hypnosis.
content: En la literatura del siglo actual, basada sobre la palabra y sobre un tipo de hipnosis basada sobre el cierre de los ojos existen rarísimos (si no nulos) testimonios de la posibilidad de amnesias así rápidas[157]. Una explicación que podemos buscar de dar al proceso que verificamos a menudo es el siguiente: a través de la fascinación nosotros creamos en el sujeto un estado de híper atención. En práctica se verifica un estado de acentuada vigilancia. Se trata de un estado de excitación en el cual el sistema nervioso simpático la bomba de las hormonas, los neurotransmisores, y los péptidos necesarios del estado de despertar. Durante el fenómeno se verifica la llamada “visión del túnel”. Esta visión del túnel reduce el campo visivo del híper amnésico. Parte de aquello e la percepción del propio estado de ser y por lo tanto en aquel momento puede ser analgesia espontanea.
last_phrase: In summary, hyper amnesia resulting from hypnosis based on fascination can be explained by a state of hyper-vigilance and tunnel vision, leading to a reduced visual field and spontaneous analgesia. The amnesia is often followed by a state of relaxation, which may explain why memories are often absent. Fascination and telepathy are related phenomena that involve the intense imagination of one person on the body or mind of another. Understanding these phenomena can help in dealing with related experiences.
